moves.1. e4 e5 2. Nf3 Nf6: Want a perfectly symmetrical game here? I expected Nc6 first.
moves.3. Nc3: I expect 3 ... Nc6, the four knights defense.
moves.3... Bc5: Bishop over four knights I can deal with too.
moves.4... Qe7: I expected Nc6, the four knights variation of Giuoco Piano.
moves.5. O-O Ng4 6. h3: Catches the knight, with no safe retreat except the 6th rank.
moves.6... Nh6 7. d4: I believe this is an exchange combination that could have been handled by Nc6...
moves.7... exd4 8. Nxd4 b6: Not Bxd4 Qxd4 taking out the DSB.
moves.9. Nd5: Good move here, threatening to capture the queen.
moves.9... Qxe4: And black considers this retreat square, picking off the e pawn that's now helpless.
moves.10... f5: Defending with f5 only leads to Nxf5 Nxf5.
moves.11. Nxf5 Qe6: Or this, this time defended by d7.
moves.12... Qxe1+: Trades the queen for the rook,
moves.13. Qxe1+: and I still get control of the e file!
moves.13... Kf8 14. Ng6+: If it were not for that h pawn...
moves.14... hxg6 15. Be3 gxf5 16. Bg5: Violates principle by moving the DSB along the same dark diagonal in two moves without capture. Better is 15 Bg5 right away.
moves.16... Bb7 17. b4: Trying to get that DSB out of the a3-f6 diagonal needed to prevent mate. If Bxb4 Qxb4+ threatens Qe7#.
moves.17... Bd4: Out of that critical diagonal, so...
